snippet: The state attorney general, Roy Cooper, a Democrat, said on Friday he would appeal a federal court ruling that struck down a Republican-backed state law requiring abortion providers to conduct an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before an...
abstract: North Carolina State Atty Gen Roy Cooper, Democrat, says he will appeal a federal court ruling that struck down a Republican-backed state law requiring abortion providers to conduct an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before an abortion.
lead_paragraph: The state attorney general, Roy Cooper, a Democrat, said on Friday he would appeal a federal court ruling that struck down a Republican-backed state law requiring abortion providers to conduct an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before an abortion.

headline.main: North Carolina: Attorney General to Appeal Ultrasound Ruling
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Attorney General to Appeal Ultrasound Ruling
